doc.ContractDescription: PLATE ASSEMBLY,STAU

ONE OF THE SWOT DATA PRODUCTS WILL BE A DYNAMIC WATER MASK OVER LAND, WHICH WILL IN TURN BE UTILIZED TO DERIVE OTHER HYDROLOGICALLY IMPORTANT PRODUCTS SUCH AS WATER SURFACE ELEVATIONS AND DISCHARGE. WE PROPOSE TO EXPLORE AND REFINE TERRESTRIAL WATER CLASSIFICATION METHODOLOGIES FOR SWOT FOCUSING ON LAND/WATER DELINEATION. INITIAL STUDIES WITH SIMULATED SWOT DATA HAVE PREDICTED GOOD PERFORMANCE USING RUDIMENTARY CLASSIFICATION APPROACHES FOR LAKES AND WATER BODIES IN THE PRAIRIE POTHOLES REGION. HOWEVER, THESE RESULTS ARE VERY PRELIMINARY IN THAT THEY ASSUME A CERTAIN BACKSCATTER MODEL IN A LOW RELIEF REGION. A PARTICULAR CONCERN THAT MAY LIMIT THE CLASSIFICATION RESOLUTION IS THE WATER SURFACE DECORRELATION TIME. LIMITED BRIDGE-BASED OBSERVATIONS OF NEAR-NADIR BACKSCATTER HAVE SHOWN THAT SURFACE TEMPORAL DECORRELATION CAN RANGE FROM JUST A FEW MS TO TENS OF MS. AN IMPORTANT IMPLICATION OF THIS RESULT IS THAT RAPID TEMPORAL DECORRELATION WILL LIMIT THE AZIMUTH RESOLUTION OVER THE WATER, AND THEREFORE THE ABILITY TO ACCURATELY SPECIFY ITS SPATIAL EXTENT. THE LATTER IS A KEY VARIABLE IN STORAGE AND DISCHARGE CALCULATIONS, AND OBVIOUSLY VERY IMPORTANT FOR THE DELIVERY OF SWOT DATA PRODUCTS. AS MEMBERS OF THE SWOT SDT, MOLLER AND ANDREADIS WILL EXPAND THE RUDIMENTARY CLASSIFICATION WORK TO DIRECTLY ASSESS THE IMPACT OF WATER SURFACE DECORRELATION, VARIABLE TERRAIN AND LAND COVER CONDITIONS OVER A BROADER CLASS OF RIVERINE AND LAKE/WETLAND SYSTEMS. IN ORDER TO ACCOMPLISH THAT, WE WILL RUN THE SWOT INSTRUMENT SIMULATOR DEVELOPED UNDER THE THP VIRTUAL MISSION (MOLLER PI) OVER SEVERAL STUDY REGIONS (OHIO, BANGLADESH, OB) FOR WHICH HYDRODYNAMIC SIMULATIONS ALREADY EXIST OR ARE BEING PRODUCED AS PART OF ALREADY FUNDED WORK (E.G. THP WITH PI ANDREADIS). USING THE GENERATED SYNTHETIC OBSERVATIONS, THE CLASSIFICATION APPROACHES WILL BE REFINED TO INCORPORATE SPATIO-TEMPORAL FILTERING AND A HYDROMORPHOLOGICAL CLASSIFICATION. IN PARTICULAR A PRIORI AND ANCILLARY DATA (SUCH AS TOPOGRAPHY) AND AN OBJECT IDENTIFICATION ALGORITHM BASED ON RIVER/LAKE HEIGHT VARIANCE AND HYDROMORPHOLOGY WILL BE UTILIZED TO FACILITATE THE CLASSIFICATION PROCESS. FINALLY, A SIMPLE RIVER FLOW MODEL (BASED ON MANNING'S EQUATION) WILL BE DEVELOPED AND USED TO QUANTIFY THE SENSITIVITY OF DISCHARGE AND WATER SURFACE ELEVATION ON CLASSIFICATION ERRORS. FURTHERMORE, AS RELEVANT, WE WILL USE AIRSWOT DATA TO TEST APPLICABLE ELEMENTS OF THE CLASSIFICATION AS WELL INCORPORATE OBSERVED BACKSCATTER AND DECORRELATION STATISTICS INTO THE SWOT INSTRUMENT SIMULATOR. THIS WILL FURTHER ENHANCE THE OVERALL CLASSIFICATION ALGORITHM FIDELITY.

IGF::OT::IGF - NO COST TIME EXTENSION - ABT ASSOCIATES - ONGOING SUPPORT AND DEVELOPMENT TO THE CORPS ALTERNATIVE FINANCING PROGRAM INCLUDING DEVELOPMENT OF IMPLEMENTATION GUIDANCE FOR WRRDA SECTIONS 1014, 1043(B) AND 5014
8502832487!TROUGH COVER
8502907231!TROUGH COVER
IGF::OT::IGF THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO EXTEND THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE. THE NEW PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE IS: 03/19/2015 - 06/18/2016
THE PURPOSE OF THIS NO COST MODIFICATION IS TO CHANGE THE UNIT OF MEASURE FROM "EACH" TO "ROLL".

PRECISION CLOCKS ARE NEEDED IN A BROAD RANGE OF APPLICATIONS, INCLUDING COMMUNICATION, COMPUTING SYSTEMS, AND NAVIGATION, SUCH AS THE GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM (CPS). THE MOST ACCURATE TIME AND FREQUENCY STANDARDS DEVELOPED TO DATE ARE ATOMIC CLOCKS, WHICH DERIVE THEIR STABILITY FROM ELECTRONIC TRANSITIONS IN ATOMS. 1\.IOST MODERN ATOMIC CLOCKS RELY ON PRECISELY MEASURED INTERNAL HYPERFINE LEVEL SPLITTINGS OF ATOMS. HOWEVER, SUCH CLOCKS REQUIRE A VOLUME OF SEVERAL TENS OF CUBIC METERS, TOO LARGE FOR MOST APPLICATIONS. AT THE OTHER EXTREME, MUCH RESEARCH HAS BEEN DIRECTED SIDES TO CREATE A RESONANT CAVITY FOR 532NM LASER EXCITATION TO PUMP THE FULL DIAMOND CHIP WITH LOW POWER (MW-RANGE) TOWARD MINIATURIZING ATOMIC CLOCKS FROM AN ON-CHIP GREEN LASER DIODE. A CHIP-INTEGRATED SILICON FOR APPLICATIONS SUCH AS SATEL- PHOTODETECTOR UNDER THE DIAMOND CAVITY COLLECTS THE DIALITES AND SCIENTIFIC INSTRUMENTS. MOND NV COLOR CENTER'S SPIN-DEPENDENT EMISSION DIRECTLY. SMALLER CLOCKS WILL ENABLE HIGHPERFORMANCE CLOCK GENERATORS FOR MICROWAVE FIELDS ARE APPLIED TO THE ENTIRE SAMPLE BY A PIANAR STRIP-LINE. (C) LAYOUT OF MICROWAVE SOURCE AND SILICON PHOTODETECTOR, FABRICATED IN A 193-NM CMOS PROCESS. (D) THE PROPOSED CHIP-BASED DEVICE IS RADIATION HARD, HIGHLY SHORT-RANGE NEXT-GENERATION WIRELESS (MILLIMETER-WAVE) COMMUNICAT IONS (SINCE EXISTING QUARTZ-BASED OSCILLATORS SUFFER FROM HIGH PHASE DURABLE, AND HAS LOW POWER CONSUMPTION, IDEAL FOR THE HARSH NOISE WHEN THEIR FREQUENCY IS SCALED SPACE ENVIRONMENT, AND IS EASILY INTEGRATED IN A SMALL SATELUP [2]) . IN ADDITION, MOBILE DEVICES LITE SUCH AS A CUBESAT. CAN SHARE GPS TIME SIGNALS FOR MAINTAINING COMMUNICATION STANDARDS [3], BUT ARE SUSCEPTIBLE TO OBSTRUCTION OR JAMMING OF THE EXTERNAL CLOCK SIGNAL- AGAIN, A PORTABLE HIGH-PERFORMANCE CLOCK THAT IS SMALL ENOUGH TO BE INCORPORATED IN THE MOBILE DEVICE COULD MAINTAIN SYNCHRONIZATION
LABORATORY, DATA ANALYSIS, AND COORDINATING CENTER (LDACC) FOR THE GENOTYPE-TISSUE EXPRESSION (GTEX) PROJECT - A NIH COMMON FUND INITIATIVE
